verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"Oh that <S%H3863><s%> my anguish <S%H3708><s%> were <S%H8254><s%> weighed, <S%H8254><s%> and all my calamity <S%H1942><s%> laid <S%H5375><s%> in <S%H3162><s%> the balances! <S%H3976><s%>
For now it would be heavier <S%H3513><s%> than the sand <S%H2344><s%> of the seas, <S%H3220><s%> therefore have my words <S%H1697><s%> been rash. <S%H3886><s%>

For the arrows <S%H2671><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> are within <S%H5978><s%> me. <S%H7307><s%> My spirit drinks up <S%H8354><s%> their poison. <S%H2534><s%> The terrors <S%H1161><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> set themselves in array against me. <S%H6186><s%>
Does the wild donkey <S%H6501><s%> bray <S%H5101><s%> when he has grass? <S%H1877><s%> Or does the ox <S%H7794><s%> low <S%H1600><s%> over his fodder? <S%H1098><s%>
Can that which has no flavor <S%H8602><s%> be eaten <S%H398><s%> without salt? <S%H4417><s%> Or is there <S%H3426><s%> any taste <S%H2940><s%> in the white <S%H7388><s%> of an egg? <S%H2495><s%>
My soul <S%H5315><s%> refuses <S%H3985><s%> to touch <S%H5060><s%> them. <S%H1741><s%> They are as loathsome food to me. <S%H3899><s%>
"Oh that I might have <S%H935><s%> my request, <S%H7596><s%> that God <S%H433><s%> would grant <S%H5414><s%> the thing that I long for, <S%H8615><s%>
even that it would please <S%H2974><s%> God <S%H433><s%> to crush <S%H1792><s%> me; <S%H5425><s%> that he would let loose his hand, <S%H3027><s%> and cut me off! <S%H1214><s%>

Be it still my consolation, <S%H5165><s%> yes, <S%H5539><s%> let me exult in pain <S%H2427><s%> that doesn't <S%H2550><s%> spare, that I have not denied <S%H3582><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of the Holy One. <S%H6918><s%>
What is my strength, <S%H3581><s%> that I should wait? <S%H3176><s%> What is my end, <S%H7093><s%> that I should be <S%H5315><s%> patient? <S%H748><s%>
Is my strength <S%H3581><s%> the strength <S%H3581><s%> of stones? <S%H68><s%> Or is my flesh <S%H1320><s%> of brass? <S%H5153><s%>
Isn't <S%H5833><s%> it that I have no help in me, <S%H8454><s%> That wisdom is driven quite from me? <S%H5080><s%>

"To him who is ready <S%H4523><s%> to faint, <S%H2617><s%> kindness should be shown from his friend; <S%H7453><s%> even to him who forsakes <S%H5800><s%> the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Almighty. <S%H7706><s%>
My brothers <S%H251><s%> have dealt deceitfully <S%H898><s%> as a brook, <S%H5158><s%> as the channel <S%H650><s%> of brooks <S%H5158><s%> that pass away; <S%H5674><s%>
Which are black <S%H6937><s%> by reason of the ice, <S%H7140><s%> in which the snow <S%H7950><s%> hides itself. <S%H5956><s%>
In <S%H6256><s%> the dry season, <S%H6256><s%> they vanish. <S%H6789><s%> When it is hot, <S%H2527><s%> they are consumed out <S%H1846><s%> of their place. <S%H4725><s%>
The caravans <S%H734><s%> that travel beside <S%H1870><s%> them turn aside. <S%H3943><s%> They go <S%H5927><s%> up into the waste, <S%H8414><s%> and perish. <S%H6><s%>
The caravans <S%H734><s%> of Tema <S%H8485><s%> looked. <S%H5027><s%> The companies <S%H1979><s%> of Sheba <S%H7614><s%> waited for them. <S%H6960><s%>
They were distressed <S%H954><s%> because they were confident. <S%H982><s%> They came <S%H935><s%> there, <S%H2659><s%> and were confounded.
For now you are nothing. <S%H7200><s%> You see a terror, <S%H2866><s%> and are afraid. <S%H3372><s%>
Did I say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H3051><s%> 'Give to me? <S%H7809><s%>' or, 'Offer a present for me from your substance? <S%H3581><s%>'
or, <S%H4422><s%> 'Deliver me from the adversary <S%H6862><s%>'s hand? <S%H3027><s%>' or, <S%H6299><s%> 'Redeem me from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the oppressors? <S%H6184><s%>'
"Teach <S%H3384><s%> me, <S%H2790><s%> and I will hold my peace. Cause me to understand <S%H995><s%> wherein I have erred. <S%H7686><s%>
How forcible <S%H4834><s%> are words <S%H561><s%> of uprightness! <S%H3476><s%> But your reproof, <S%H3198><s%> what does it reprove? <S%H3198><s%>
Do you intend <S%H2803><s%> to reprove <S%H3198><s%> words, <S%H4405><s%> since the speeches <S%H561><s%> of one who is desperate <S%H2976><s%> are as wind? <S%H7307><s%>
Yes, <S%H5307><s%> you would even cast lots for the fatherless, <S%H3490><s%> and make merchandise <S%H3738><s%> of your friend. <S%H7453><s%>
Now therefore be pleased <S%H2974><s%> to look <S%H6437><s%> at me, <S%H6440><s%> for surely I shall not lie to your face. <S%H3576><s%>
Please return. <S%H7725><s%> Let there be no injustice. <S%H5766><s%> Yes, <S%H7725><s%> return again. My cause is righteous. <S%H6664><s%>
Is there <S%H3426><s%> injustice <S%H5766><s%> on my tongue? <S%H3956><s%> Can't <S%H2441><s%> my taste discern <S%H995><s%> mischievous things? <S%H1942><s%>
